summary: The text discusses the appearance of different forms of pure corporeal creation, such as opaque, transparent, and luminous. It highlights events like the destruction of the Roman temple and other statues, fulfilling a prophecy by Jeremiah that Egyptian idols would fall upon the birth of a virgin's child. Priests secretly placed an image of a virgin holding a child in the temple and worshiped it. A second sign involved the transformation of night into day and a spring of water in Rome transforming into oil, heralding the birth of the Savior, as prophesied by Sibyl.
